content.description: Sweet boulder 15ft off of CCC trail. Start at right side overhand with small crimp on corner and follow the rail/arete to the exciting top out. Sit start and face direct are significantly harder.
content.location: Located right off the CCC trail approx 40ft after the beginning of the final steep stairs to the Flatiron. When hiking up look for large downed tree; from teh base of this downed tree traverse 15ft left(west) to the base.When at the flat iron you can look down the trail right at the top out.

content.description:
Fun slab route and definitely not climbed enough.  Use the face only and if you eliminate the right side flake/jug it's a little bit tougher, but a lot more fun.  I love going on the boulder just left of it and doing the left side arete, then farmers daughter, the crack in between the two rocks, and then the wife for a perfect warmup. 

  The top out is a little gross.
content.location: Just on the way to rail-gun, it's the boulder on the right of the two you see right when you turn right off the ccc.

content.description: Gain steep slab using a couple thin feet to start.  First couple moves are the crux.
content.location: On the way to Rail Gun boulder, first wall on the left.

content.description: A little wall immediately next to the CCC trail, scene of confusion for many a hiker headed downhill.
